newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates end up on funds shortage.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates end up on funds shortage.

text.p: Pakistan's inter-bank money rates ended higher on Tuesday amid a persistent shortage of funds and dealers said heavy discounting with the central bank suggested rates would remain at high levels.
Overnight funds were offered at 17 percent in early trade and rose to 17.5 percent at the close, a dealer at KASB & Co said.
Banks approached the State (central) Bank of Pakistan's discount window for large amounts to square their positions, he said.
